In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```
function clean_column(col)
    col = strip(lowercase(col))
    col = replace(col, r"[ -]", "_")
    return col
end
```
This function takes a column name `col` as input and returns the cleaned column name. The function first lowercases the input using `lowercase`, then strips any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip`. Finally, it replaces any spaces and hyphens in the column name with an underscore using `replace` with a regular expression that matches either a space or a hyphen (`r"[ -]"`) and replaces it with an underscore. The resulting cleaned column name is returned.

For example, if we call the function with the input "My Column", it will return "my_column".
